en.use: * Use in patients at high risk for development of NASH (including those with diabetes mellitus type 2, obesity, and/or other markers of metabolic syndrome).
en.purpose: Screens for fibrotic NASH in individuals at high risk for NAFLD.
en.misuse: * Do not use in patients with a history of alcohol use disorder or chronic liver disease.

other_details.references:
Tavaglione F, Jamialahmadi O, De Vincentis A, et al. Development and Validation of a Score for Fibrotic Nonalcoholic Steatohepatitis. Clin Gastroenterol Hepatol. 2023;21(6):1523-1532.e1. doi:10.1016/j.cgh.2022.03.044

Jeong S, Kim HJ, Han HW. Sex-separated NAFLD/NASH Scores May Improve Predictive Performance. Clin Gastroenterol Hepatol. 2023;21(3):855-856. doi:10.1016/j.cgh.2022.04.041

then: $gt0018|FNI x|.magnitude = - 10.33 + 2.54 * log ( $gt0003|AST|.magnitude ) + 3.86 * log ( $gt0005|HbA1c result|.magnitude ) - 1.66 * log ( $gt0007|HDL Cholesterol|.magnitude )

gt0001.description:
This score consists of 3 lab values that are widely available outside of specialized hepatology clinics. Use it to screen for fibrotic nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) in high-risk patients.

* Lab values are readily available in most primary care and endocrinology clinics. 
* No invasive testing is required.

* This study was performed primarily in European populations, including the 3 external cohorts used for validation. 
* This score’s performance has not yet been compared to other noninvasive blood testing scores.

gt0003.description: The result of aspartate aminotransferase test, normal value ranges 15-41 U/L

gt0005.description: The result of Hba1c test, normal value ranges 4-5.6 % gly Hgb

gt0007.description: The result of HDL test, normal value ranges 0-60 mg/dL (0-1.55 mmol/L)

gt0016.description: FNI = ex/(1 + ex), where x = -10.33 + 2.54*ln(AST) + 3.86*ln(HbA1c) – 1.66*ln(HDL, mg/dL)
